name: Aloo Paratha
history: Aloo Paratha is a popular North Indian flatbread stuffed with spicy mashed potatoes. It's a staple in Punjabi cuisine and is enjoyed across India.
description: Aloo Paratha is a hearty, flavorful flatbread filled with a spiced potato mixture. It's typically served with butter, yogurt, or pickles.

equipment.name: rolling pin
equipment.description: A cylindrical food preparation utensil used to shape and flatten dough.

equipment.name: skillet
equipment.description: A flat-bottomed pan used for frying, searing, and browning foods.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: A bowl used for mixing ingredients.

instructions.title: Prepare Dough
instructions.description: Knead wheat flour with water to form a soft dough. Cover and set aside for 20 minutes.

instructions.title: Prepare Filling
instructions.description: Mash the boiled potatoes. Mix in onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.

instructions.title: Assemble Parathas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into balls. Roll each ball, place a portion of the filling in the center, and seal it. Roll it again gently to flatten.

instructions.title: Cook Parathas
instructions.description: Heat a skillet. Place the paratha on the skillet and cook until brown spots appear. Flip and cook the other side, applying oil or ghee.

tips: The dough should be soft for easy rolling.
Donâ€™t overfill the parathas, or they may break while rolling.
variations: Add grated cheese or paneer to the potato filling for a different flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Aloo Parathas are best eaten fresh but can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on a skillet before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a skillet or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve with a dollop of butter, yogurt, or pickle.
